title: Directs the department of health to develop information, methods and protocols for restaurants, schools, hospitals, adult homes and child day care centers
summary: Directs the department of health to develop information, methods and protocols for the voluntary reduction or elimination of the use of trans fat in restaurants, schools, hospitals, adult homes and child day care centers; establishes reporting requirements.

       Introduced  by M. of A. ORTIZ -- read once and referred to the Committee

       AN ACT to authorize the commissioner of health to  develop  a  plan  for
         voluntary  reduction or elimination in the use of trans fat in various
         food service providers

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Voluntary  trans fat reduction or elimination program. 1.
    2  The commissioner of health is hereby authorized to develop  a  voluntary
    3  trans  fat  reduction  or  elimination  program.  For  purposes  of this
    4  section, "trans fat" means a specific type of  fat  formed  when  liquid
    5  fats  are  made  into solid fats by the addition of hydrogen atoms, in a
    6  process known as hydrogenation. Such program shall consist of  two  main
    7  components: a public information campaign and a protocol for voluntarily
    8  reducing or eliminating the use of trans fats in foods prepared by:
    9    a.  food service establishments, including: restaurants, bars, member-
   10  ship organizations, fraternal organizations, and private clubs,  except-
   11  ing  establishments  licensed  pursuant to section 64-a of the alcoholic
   12  beverage control law, that are not regulated by the department of  agri-
   13  culture and markets; and
   14    b.  any institution under the jurisdiction of the department of health
   15  including, but not limited to: public schools, hospitals, nursing homes,
   16  and adult and child daycare facilities.
   17    2. The public information campaign shall be developed, in consultation
   18  with the department of education, to provide  public  service  announce-
   19  ments,  website sources and educational brochures about the health risks
   20  associated with trans fat in foods.
   21    3. The commissioner of health, in consultation with  the  commissioner
   22  of  education, shall include in the department of health's annual report
   23  not later than December 31, 2012, a report assessing the success of  the
